result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick G Skinner

records.addlTxt: Defendant Patrick G Skinner in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Patrick G Skinner.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim JTM in court.  Attorney Kathryn Lyn Knowlton in court for JTM.  State's motion for bail hearing proceeded.  Statements made by all parties.  The Court GRANTS state's motion.  The Court amended bail to $20,000.  Signature Bond with Turn Over To Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision.  Additional conditions include Absolutely No Contact with victim, No missed court dates. No Possession of Firearms or Dangerous Weapons.   Defendant does not have a phone at this time but will notify Justice Point as soon as he does to receive phone calls/texts/emails from Justice Point.   Case is adjourned in Br 45.  mn

Defendant Patrick G Skinner in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Patrick G Skinner.  Assistant District Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.  State's motion to adjourn jury trial heard.  Defense takes no position regarding adjournment.  The Court Grants the states request.  
State also requests a bail motion to be heard this afternoon, which will allow for the victim to be present.  Case is adjourned for bail motion in Br 45.  mn
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick G Skinner in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Patrick G Skinner.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury status hearing. Parties report that case remains to be in trial posture. Case adjourned to Branch 45 for jury trial on October 17th, 2022 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Patrick G Skinner in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Patrick G Skinner.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kathryn Lyn Knowlton appeared by video for JTM. 
Final pretrial documents discussed, State's offer placed on the record and rejected by defendant.  Case is adjourned in Br 45 for jury status hearing.   mn
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions, Filed.
Defendant's witness list, filed.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Patrick G Skinner not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kathryn Knowlton appeared via zoom for the victim.   Defendant's appearance waived.  Matter before the court to scheduled new final pre trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Adjourn Sentencing, filed.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Patrick G Skinner not in court, in custody. Attorney Kathryn Lyn Knowlton in court on behalf of the victim.  Jack T Eichorst appeared on behalf of Alicia Kort for the State of Wisconsin. Attorneys appeared by video means.
Case in court for Final pretrial. Defendant's appearance is waived. Defense requests an adjournment of the jury trial. States takes no position. Defense for the victim does not object. Court grants defense's motion to adjourn trial and vacates the scheduled jury trial date. Matter will be scheduled for a stauts conference to schedule a new jury trial date.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Patrick G Skinner not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial motion filing deadline 7.1.22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
rescheduled to May 20, 2022, 10:30 via Zoom.  kmw

TOT JPS Level 5 Supervision 24 hour GPS monitoring.  Any violations will result in bail reverting to $20,000.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Patrick G Skinner not in court, in custody, CJF; appearance waived..  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim statement.  Defense bail motion argued and granted.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Intent to use DNA Evidence at Trial

Defendant Patrick G Skinner in court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Patrick G Skinner in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective Z. Thoms.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Patrick G Skinner not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Patrick G Skinner not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring;  24 hour curfew with the exception of verified employment, medical, dental and legal appointments..  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jasmine M.

Defendant Patrick G Skinner in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Patrick G Skinner in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick G Skinner appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant hemay qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
